Services.name: Thrift Collection
Services.text: We encourage thrift among members so that each member may cultivate the habit of making savings at least once monthly, with a view to building up funds for their individual future use.

Services.name: Financial Adivisory
Services.text: We provide professional/Financial Advisory Services - Investment appraisal, feasibility studies, business plans etc.

Services.name: Short Term Loans
Services.text: We provide short-term loans for our members at a minimal interest rate with convenient terms of repayment.

Services.name: Goods and Services
Services.text: We stock consumer and producer goods for distribution to members and non-members; (with priority to members) at fair and reasonable prices.

Services.name: Warehouse Facilities
Services.text: We operate warehouses and cold room facilities for the storage of consumer and producer goods and let out these facilities to interested parties;

Services.name: Real estates
Services.text: We undertake investment in Real Estate and Housing developments for the acquisition of our members and other interested parties.

Testimonials.text: A Cooperative Society is a voluntary association of individuals or legal persons united by common bond, who have come together to pursue their socio-economic goals for their own benefits with high regards to non-members as their neighbors.
Testimonials.name: What is a Cooperative Society?
What are the Objectives of the Lion Multi-purpose Cooperative Society Nigeria Ltd?

Testimonials.text: "This means a person or a registered society joining in the application for registration of a society or admitted to be a member after registration in accordance with bye-laws and regulations of the society."
Testimonials.name: What does being a registered member of the society mean?

Testimonials.text: "Make your thrift savings; actively participate in all AGMs; engage and exchange valuable ideas with Management Committee members; render any other services as may be required in any capacity in the society."
Testimonials.name: What are my main responsibilities as a member of the Society?

Testimonials.text: A non-refundable entrance fee of N2,000.00 shall be paid by a new applicant or such other amount as may be fixed by the Management Committee or the general meeting.
Testimonials.name: Is there a fee payable on application for membership of the society?

Testimonials.text: Every member shall on admission sign his or her name or make his or her right thumb impression in the register or be included in the register in any other suitable and convenient form as may be agreed by the Management Committee or the general meeting.
Testimonials.name: What should I do next on admission as a member of the society?

Testimonials.text: "This is a share of the surplus of a registered society divided among its members in proportion to the volume of business done by them in the society for which the surplus is derived."
Testimonials.name: What is Patronage Rebate?

Testimonials.text: "Dividend means a share of the profits of a registered society divided among its members in proportion to share capital held by them."
Testimonials.name: What is Dividend?

Testimonials.text: "Yes, by conveying 6 months notice in writing to the General Secretary and provided such a member is not indebted to the society or standing as surety for a loan of another member that is not yet paid up."
Testimonials.name: Can a member withdraw his/her membership?

Testimonials.text:
"One ceases to be a member of the Society under any of the following conditions:

  - Death 

- Cessation of employment as specified in the Bye-Laws

- Ceases to be of sound mind 

- Ceases to reside in the area of operation of the Society as specified in the Bye-laws

- Expulsion from the Society by 2/3 majority votes at a General meeting for acts of misconduct or gross indiscipline."
Testimonials.name: Under what conditions can one lose his/her membership status?

Testimonials.text: "Yes, provided a reasonable interval of not less than 12 calendar months from date of withdrawal of membership is given."
Testimonials.name: Can I reapply for membership after withdrawal?

Testimonials.text: "A financial report of the society is presented to all members at the AGM."
Testimonials.name: How do I get briefed on the performance of the Cooperative Society?

Testimonials.text: "Member's ordinary savings contribution shall be paid to the treasurer at ordinary general meeting or deducted from his/her salary and remitted directly to the cooperatives bank account."
Testimonials.name: How do I make contribution for ordinary savings?

Testimonials.text: "No member can withdraw part or whole of his Ordinary savings except on withdrawal of Membership and a service charge of 10% will apply on such withdrawals."
Testimonials.name: Can I withdraw a part of my thrift credit contribution as any time?

Testimonials.text: "Yes; you can write to the Financial Secretary to obtain your account statement or better still, visit the Society's website with your unique log in details to get your account statement."
Testimonials.name: Can I request for my account statement as to know total thrift credit contribution I have made?

Testimonials.text: "Visit the society website and fill the Loan application form. The Management committee shall review request, approve and advise you on the amount approved. Loans request are treated on its merit and approval limits are subject to funds availability."
Testimonials.name: How do I obtain Loan facility from the Cooperative?

Testimonials.text: "Your loan limit is thrice (3 times) the total amount of your contribution at the time of submitting request."
Testimonials.name: What is the maximum loan limit I am entitled to request for?

Testimonials.text: Loans are to be paid back within 12 calendar months. However waivers for 24 months may be granted on the merit of the request by the Management Committee. This might attract additional interest.
Testimonials.name: What is the maximum Tenor for the loan to be repaid?

Testimonials.text: "N5,000.00 per month."
Testimonials.name: What is the minimum thrift savings amount I can contribute monthly?

Testimonials.text: "Loans shall be made only to persons of a minimum of 6 months membership."
Testimonials.name: On joining the cooperative, how soon can I be considered for a loan on request?

Testimonials.text: The Executive or Management committee shall consist of at least Seven (7) and not more than Eleven (11) members elected at annual general meeting and not more than four (4) Ex-officio members, at least two (2) of who shall be the immediate past President and General Secretary. At the event of the vacancy occurring during the year, he/her shall be elected at any General meeting. Any member aspiring for the position of the President, General Secretary and Treasurer must have spent not less than two (2) years as a member of the cooperative society.
Testimonials.name: What is Management Committee?

Testimonials.text:
Members’ one year normal loan   -11%.

Members’ two years normal loan    -15%.

Members’ Housing project loan    -15%.

Members’ land loan    -16%.

Members’ car loan    -16%.

Members’ motocycle loan    -16%.

Members’ tricycle loan    -16%.

Members’ mark-up for Commodity Purchase    -5%.

Members’ mark-up for Electronics Purchase    -7%.

Members’ mark-up for Stationary Purchase    -7%.

Members’ mark-up for Office Equipment purchase    -7%.

Members’ emergency loan (not exceeding one year)   -19%.

Education Savings (Withdrawable at the end of each year)   -5%.

Christmas Savings (Withdrawable at the end of each year)   -4%.

Special Deposits(withdrawable within one year    -4%.

Local purchasing order financing(as may be agreed but not less than)    -19%.

Charges on Retirement Savings    -10%.

Loan handling charges (0.25% of total loan request)

Investment Appraisal/Feasility Study(Fee as agreed)

Interest on loan and handling charges shall be collected up-front before disbursement of loan balance to the beneficiary
Testimonials.name: What are the interest rates for each type of credits?

Testimonials.text: Interest on loan and handling charges shall be collected up-front before disbursement of loan balance to the beneficiary.
Testimonials.name: At what point am I expected to pay interest on loan and handling charges?

Testimonials.text:
The loan shall be repaid in equal monthly installments, the number of which shall not normally exceed twelve or twenty-four months or any other period as may be agreed by the management committee or the general meeting.

 a. The first installment shall fall due at the end of the month following the month in which the loan is taken.

 b. In all cases, repayment by installment shall go simultaneously with the payment of ordinary savings and special savings.

  c. Loan may be immediately recalled by the committee if misapplied and the member shall execute a bond or post-dated cheque in favour of the society and for every loan taken, two sureties shall be provided or collateral security where the loan exceeds the member’s savings. In addition, loan application shall be submitted with an affidavit of repayment covenant.
Testimonials.name: What other information can assist me make a loan decision?

Testimonials.text: The general meeting shall be held monthly or at least once in every three months or at any other shorter or convenient time.
Testimonials.name: How often am I expected to participate in the general meeting?

Testimonials.text: I should have attained the age of 16, be of good character, capable of paying my dues and resident in the area of operation of the society or any other place acceptable to the Cooperative.
Testimonials.name: How do I know if I am qualified/eligible to become a Member of the Society?

Testimonials.text: An Entrance fee of N2,000.00 shall be paid by a new applicant or such other amount as may be fixed by the Management Committee.
Testimonials.name: Is there a fee payable on application for membership of the society?

Testimonials.text: Every member shall on admission sign his or her name or make his or her right thumb impression in the register or be included in the register in any other suitable and convenient form as may be agreed by the Management Committee or the general meeting.
Testimonials.name: What should I do next on admission as a member of the society?

Testimonials.text: This is the minimum compulsory and non-withdrawable amount each member is expected to contribute in order to become a part owner of the society. The current minimum share capital is N100,000.00 which can be paid within the first 20 months of admission to membership. This amount can be reviewed by the management committee subject to approval of 2/3 of the general meeting.
Testimonials.name: What is minimum Share Capital?

Testimonials.text: Maximum Share capital is the upper limit a member is allowed to contribute as part owner of the society. The current maximum share capital is N5,000,000.00 which can be upgraded at any time. This amount can be reviewed by the management committee subject to approval of 2/3 of the general meeting.
Testimonials.name: What is maximum Share Capital?

Testimonials.text: Ordinary savings is the normal non-withdrawable contribution made by members of the society, which enables them to access loans that are at least three times the total of their savings. Members are to contribute a minimum of N5,000.00 as monthly savings or any other amount that might be subsequently approved by the general meeting or the management committee.
Testimonials.name: What is Ordinary Savings and the minimum monthly savings?

Testimonials.text: In addition to his/her ordinary savings, member may make special savings which may be withdrawn, leaving minimum of one month’s contribution in this account or withdrawal of the entire sum after deduction of a service charge by the cooperative Society as may be determined or once in every three months, provided that a committee may require not less than two weeks notice to that effect for emergency or on the 14th day of every month for normal withdrawal.
Testimonials.name: What is Special Savings?

Testimonials.text: A retirement savings can be made and withdraw-able on retirement or any other stated period that is not less than 10years. This type of savings will enable the owner benefit a minimum of 4% annual interest.
Testimonials.name: What is retirement savings?

Testimonials.text: A member may make any deposits of any amount at any time and these may be withdrawn as required provided that not less than a month notice shall be required for withdrawal of large amount.
Testimonials.name: What is Special Deposits?

Testimonials.text: Buffer savings are irregular deposits made as part of a member’s ordinary savings. However, savings made with the intention to apply for immediate loan is not acceptable, except the member depositing the amount will wait for at least 3 months after buffer savings before applying for loan.
Testimonials.name: What is buffer savings and what are the conditions to be granted a loan request after buffer savings?
